item.title: Jeff add a quote by Alex Comfort
item.description: "The things that stop you having sex with age are exactly the same as those that stop you riding a bicycle." -- Alex Comfort

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Daniel Gilbert
item.description: "The average newspaper boy in Pittsburgh knows more about the universe than did Galileo, Aristotle, Leonardo, or any of those other guys who were so smart they only needed one name." -- Daniel Gilbert

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "When you know a thing, to hold that you know it; and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it--this is knowledge." -- Confucius

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Almost all the joyful things of life are outside the measure of IQ tests." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeff add a quote by George Vaillant
item.description: "The only thing that really matters in life are your relationships to other people." -- George Vaillant

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Richard Rodgers
item.description: "Whenever I feel afraid I hold my head erect and whistle a happy tune." -- Richard Rodgers

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Daniel Gilbert
item.description: "If someone offered you a pill that would make you permanently happy, you would be well advised to run fast and run far. Emotion is a compass that tells us what to do, and a compass that perpetually stuck on north is worthless." -- Daniel Gilbert

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Life does not consist mainly, or even largely, of facts or happenings. It consist mainly of the storm of thoughts that is forever flowing through one's head." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeff add a quote by National Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty, 1992
item.description: "Why do we kill people who kill people to show that killing people is wrong?" -- National Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty, 1992

item.title: Jeff add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "When two people are under the influence of the most violent, most insane, most delusive, and most transient of passions, they are required to swear that they will remain in that excited, abnormal, and exhausting condition continuously until death do them part." -- George Bernard Shaw
